sources: O'Mahony D, et al. STOPP/START criteria for potentially inappropriate prescribing in older people: version 3. Eur Geriatr Med. 2023;14:625-632.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Digoxin at dose >0.125mg/day with impaired renal function
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of digoxin toxicity if renal function impaired. Reduce dose in renal impairment.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Loop diuretic as first-line treatment for hypertension
stopp_criteria.rationale: Safer, more effective alternatives available for hypertension. Loop diuretics indicated for heart failure, not hypertension.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Beta-blocker with bradycardia (<50 bpm), type II heart block, or sick sinus syndrome
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of severe bradycardia, syncope, cardiac arrest.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Benzodiazepines for >=4 weeks
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of prolonged sedation, confusion, impaired balance, falls, road traffic accidents. Tolerance and withdrawal effects.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Antipsychotics (other than quetiapine or clozapine) in patients with parkinsonism or Lewy body dementia
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of severe extrapyramidal symptoms and neuroleptic malignant syndrome.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Anticholinergics/antimuscarinics in patients with dementia or cognitive impairment
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of worsening cognitive impairment, confusion, agitation.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Neuroleptic antipsychotics in patients with behavioral/psychological symptoms of dementia unless severe and non-pharmacological approaches have failed
stopp_criteria.rationale: Increased risk of stroke and mortality. Non-pharmacological interventions preferred first-line.

stopp_criteria.criterion: PPI for uncomplicated peptic ulcer disease or erosive peptic esophagitis at full therapeutic dosage for >8 weeks
stopp_criteria.rationale: Dose reduction or earlier discontinuation indicated. Risk of C. difficile, hypomagnesemia, bone fractures.

stopp_criteria.criterion: NSAID with concurrent anticoagulant therapy
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of major GI bleeding synergistically increased.

stopp_criteria.criterion: NSAID with severe hypertension or heart failure
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of worsening hypertension and heart failure exacerbation.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Long-term NSAID (>3 months) for symptom relief of osteoarthritis without gastroprotection
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of GI bleeding increases with prolonged use.

stopp_criteria.criterion: NSAID with eGFR <50 mL/min/1.73m2
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of further deterioration of renal function.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Metformin with eGFR <30 mL/min/1.73m2
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of lactic acidosis.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Sulfonylureas with a long duration of action (glibenclamide/glyburide, chlorpropamide, glimepiride) in type 2 diabetes
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of prolonged hypoglycemia in older adults.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Benzodiazepines in patients with history of falls in past 3 months
stopp_criteria.rationale: Sedating drugs increase fall risk. May cause drowsiness, impaired balance.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Hypnotic Z-drugs in patients with history of falls
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of drowsiness, motor incoordination, increased falls.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Regular opioids without concurrent laxative
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of severe constipation, bowel obstruction.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Long-acting opioids without short-acting opioid for breakthrough pain
stopp_criteria.rationale: Inadequate pain control without breakthrough medication.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Concurrent use of two or more drugs with anticholinergic properties
stopp_criteria.rationale: Risk of cumulative anticholinergic toxicity: cognitive impairment, falls, constipation, urinary retention.

stopp_criteria.criterion: Duplicate drug class prescriptions (two concurrent NSAIDs, SSRIs, loop diuretics, ACE inhibitors)
stopp_criteria.rationale: Optimization of monotherapy within a single drug class before adding second agent.

start_criteria.criterion: Statin therapy with documented history of coronary, cerebral or peripheral vascular disease where functional status is not severely limited
start_criteria.rationale: Secondary prevention of cardiovascular events unless end-of-life/severe frailty.

start_criteria.criterion: ACE inhibitor or ARB in patients with heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
start_criteria.rationale: Reduce mortality and hospitalization in HFrEF.

start_criteria.criterion: Antiplatelet therapy in patients with documented atherosclerotic coronary, cerebral or peripheral vascular disease
Vitamin D supplement in patients with known osteoporosis or previous fragility fracture
start_criteria.rationale: Reduce further bone loss and fracture risk.

start_criteria.criterion: Bone anti-resorptive or anabolic therapy in patients with known osteoporosis where no pharmacological or clinical contraindication
L-DOPA or dopamine agonist in idiopathic Parkinson's disease with functional impairment
start_criteria.rationale: Improve motor function and quality of life.

start_criteria.criterion: PPI in patients with severe GERD or peptic stricture requiring dilatation
start_criteria.rationale: Symptom relief and prevention of esophageal stricture recurrence.

start_criteria.criterion: Regular inhaled beta-2 agonist or anticholinergic agent for mild-moderate asthma or COPD
start_criteria.rationale: Improve FEV1, symptoms, and quality of life.

start_criteria.criterion: DMARD in patients with active moderate-severe rheumatoid arthritis
start_criteria.rationale: Disease-modifying therapy to prevent joint destruction.
Reduce mortality and morbidity from influenza in older adults.
